meanings.definition: To assign a value or importance to something before it occurs.
meanings.sent1: I always prevalue my time before starting a new project.
meanings.sent2: It is important to prevalue the potential risks before making a decision.
meanings.sent3: The team decided to prevalue the outcome of the game by analyzing their opponents' strategies.
meanings.sent4: She prevalued the impact of her words before speaking at the conference.
meanings.sent5: Prevaluing the consequences can help prevent future mistakes.

meanings.definition: The value or importance assigned to something before it occurs.
meanings.sent1: The prevalue of the event was underestimated by many attendees.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the prevalue of a situation can lead to better decision-making.
meanings.sent3: The prevalue of the antique vase turned out to be much higher than expected.
meanings.sent4: His prevalue of the project's success motivated him to work harder.
meanings.sent5: The prevalue of education should never be underestimated.
